#Text=Giorgio Mainerio
#Text=Giorgio Mainerio
#Text=( ca .
#Text=1530-1540 – 3 or 4 May 1582 ) was an Italian musician , composer , and occultist .
#Text=Biography
#Text=Mainerio was born in Parma , Italy between 1530 and 1540 .
#Text=His father is thought to have been Scottish given that Giorgio signed Mayner as his family name .
#Text=During his education he studied music , but he did not immediately begin a musical career .
#Text=In 1560 , being a presbyter , he sought work as a chaplain and altarista by the church of Santa Maria Annunziata in Udine .

#Text=In Udine , Mainerio spent ten years ( from 1560 to 1570 ) and there , thanks to his previous musical knowledge and to the lessons given to him by two local contrapuntists , Gabriele Martinengo ( Maestro di cappella from 1562 to 1567 ) and Ippolito Chiamaterò ( Maestro di cappella from 1567 to 1570 ) , he started his musical career .
#Text=After three years in Udine he became interested in occultism ( astrology , magic and necromancy ) and there were rumours that — together with some women — he was attending night-rites .
#Text=The Inquisition in Aquileia started a preliminary investigation but the case was closed for lack of evidence .

#Text=After the investigation , Mainiero had more troubles with his colleagues in the Chapter of Udine and , after applying for a position at the Patriarchal Basilica of Aquileia , he quit partially the job in Udine , motivating his decision with " impellent although honest reasons " .
#Text=He was accepted at Aquileia and moved there , living in the quiet and isolated Patriarchate .
#Text=In 1578 he became Maestro di cappella at the church of S. Chiesa d'Aquilegia .
#Text=During the last years of his life he had problems with his health and often left the church in favour of travels to Venice , Ancona , and thermal baths .
#Text=His death was announced to the Chapter on May 4 , 1582 .
#Text=Works
#Text=Mainerio mainly wrote works of Musica Sacra , although he published collection of popular songs and dances , Il primo libro de ' balli .
#Text=Magnificat octo tonorum ... cum quatuor vocibus
#Text=containing a Regina coeli was published by Mainerio and printed in Venice by G. Bariletto in 1574 .
#Text=Il primo libro de balli accomodati per cantar et sonar d'ogni sorte de instromenti di Giorgio Mainerio Parmeggiano Maestro di Capella della S. Chiesa d'Aquilegia
#Text=was printed by Gardano in Venice in 1578 .

#Text=Later , he published another ten Magnificat s collected under the title of Sacra cantica Beatissimae M. Virg . omnitonum sex vocum parium canenda , integrated by a motet ( also six-part ) named O sacrum convivium : they all were printed in Venice in 1580 by Angelo Gardano .
#Text=Popular culture

#Text=An adaptation of Mainerio 's Schiarazula Marazula appears as " Ballo in Fa diesis minore " on Angelo Branduardi ' s 1977 album La pulce d'acqua ( English edition as Fables and Fantasies , 1980 ) .
#Text=Mainerio 's character appears in a story of the popular Italian comics book / horror Dampyr , issued monthly by Sergio Bonelli Editore .

#Text=The story , entitled Il musicista stregato ( " The Bewitched Musician " ) and published in #107 of the regular series in February 2009 , was written by Mauro Boselli on a plot by Mario Faggella and drawn by Mario Rossi ( Majo ) .

#Text=It reinterprets real aspects of Mainerio 's life ( particularly his interest in occultism and magic ) in a fantastic tone , combining them with some myths of Friulan folklore such as agane , female water demons similar to Scottish bean nighes .
#Text=Media
